1.text: Select seeds and grains that pigeons normally eat in the wild.

2.text: Choose an open platform or tray feeder that pigeons can perch on.

3.text: Hang the feeder low to the ground near plants and trees.

4.text: Sit quietly at a distance to avoid scaring approaching pigeons.

5.text: Feed pigeons around the same time every day to attract more.

6.text: Sweep up hulls and other debris after pigeons are done feeding.

7.text: Set up a shallow birdbath with fresh water.

8.text: Hang a nesting shelf in your yard to keep pigeons around.

9.text: Plant some shrubs, bushes, or trees if there aren’t any nearby.
